item.title: AlTonya add a quote by Debbi Fields
item.description: "The important thing is not being afraid to take a chance. Remember, the greatest failure is to not try. Once you find something you love to do, be the best at doing it." -- Debbi Fields

item.title: AlTonya add a quote by John Boyle O'Reilly
AlTonya add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Good books don't give up all their secrets at once." -- Stephen King

item.title: AlTonya add a quote by Richard Wright
item.description: "Reading was like a drug, a dope. The novels created moods in which I lived for days." -- Richard Wright

item.title: AlTonya add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Every saint has a past, and every sinner has a future." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: AlTonya add a quote by Søren Kierkegaard
item.description: "Life can only be understood backwards; but it must be lived forwards." -- Søren Kierkegaard

item.title: AlTonya add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: AlTonya add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: AlTonya add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: AlTonya add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: AlTonya add a quote by Zora Neale Hurston
item.description: "There are years that ask questions and years that answer." -- Zora Neale Hurston

item.title: AlTonya add a quote by Nathaniel Hawthorne
item.description: "Easy reading is damn hard writing." -- Nathaniel Hawthorne

item.title: AlTonya add a quote by Jarod Kintz
item.description: "The mouth is made for communication, and nothing is more articulate than a kiss." -- Jarod Kintz

item.title: AlTonya add a quote by Isaac Marion
item.description: "Writing isn't letters on paper. It's communication. It's memory." -- Isaac Marion

item.title: AlTonya add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "The single biggest problem in communication is the illusion that it has taken place." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: AlTonya add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "It’s hard to communicate anything exactly and that’s why perfect relationships between people are difficult to find." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: AlTonya add a quote by Marquis de Sade
item.description: "Conversation, like certain portions of the anatomy, always runs more smoothly when lubricated." -- Marquis de Sade

item.title: AlTonya add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "If a writer stops observing he is finished. Experience is communicated by small details intimately observed." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: AlTonya add a quote by Kristen Ashley
item.description: "Men understand direct communication. It's bitches who speak in code." -- Kristen Ashley

item.title: AlTonya add a quote by Lawrence Clark Powell
item.description: "Write to be understood, speak to be heard, read to grow." -- Lawrence Clark Powell

item.title: AlTonya add a quote by William Butler Yeats
item.description: "Think like a wise man but communicate in the language of the people." -- William Butler Yeats

item.title: AlTonya add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "Beware Those Who Are ALWAYS READING BOOKS" -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: AlTonya add a quote by Alan Kay
item.description: "The best way to predict the future is to invent it." -- Alan Kay

item.title: AlTonya add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "A good library will never be too neat, or too dusty, because somebody will always be in it, taking books off the shelves and staying up late reading them." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: AlTonya add a quote by Stewart O'Nan
item.description: "You couldn't relive your life, skipping the awful parts, without losing what made it worthwhile. You had to accept it as a whole--like the world, or the person you loved." -- Stewart O'Nan

item.title: AlTonya add a quote by Martin Luther
item.description: "God writes the gospel not in the Bible alone, but on trees and flowers and clouds and stars." -- Martin Luther

item.title: AlTonya add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: AlTonya add a quote by Irwin Shaw
item.description: "There are too many books I haven’t read, too many places I haven’t seen, too many memories I haven’t kept long enough." -- Irwin Shaw

item.title: AlTonya add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: AlTonya add a quote by Clare Boothe Luce
item.description: "Money can't buy happiness, but it can make you awfully comfortable while you're being miserable." -- Clare Boothe Luce
